==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|す|てき|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=すてき|素|tr1=su|pos1=abbreviation of {{m|ja|素晴らしい}} ''subarashii'', “wonderful, superb”|的|tr2=teki|t2=-ish, -like|pos=adjectivizing suffix}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref><ref name="SMK5">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref>  First appears in the {{w|Edo period}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>

The use of {{m|ja|敵|tr=teki||enemy}} instead of {{m|ja|的|tr=teki||-ish, -like}} is an example of phonetic {{ateji|sort=すてき}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|すてき|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|素的}}

===Adjective===
{{ja-adj|infl=な|すてき}}

# [[lovely]]
# [[wonderful]], [[splendid]]

====Synonyms====
* {{sense|wonderful}} {{ja-r|素晴らしい|すばらしい|wonderful}}, {{ja-r|凄い|すごい|amazing}}

====Inflection====
{{ja-na|すてき}}

====Usage notes====
Generally regarded as an informal word to be used in speech, and not in formal writing.<ref name="SMK5">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref>
